  physical_appearance: This print captures a man docking a sampan and securing its oars. He dons a sarong bottom and has his head wrapped in a head scarf. There is yellowing along the perimeter of the print
 and the backing on which it is mounted has brown spotting. On the bottom right corner of the print
 an RPS Associate 1957 is embossed and on the verso
 the photographer studio\u0027s chop and title of the work can be found.

  subject_terms_1: headscarves boats docks (general waterside structures)

  subject_terms_2: Wooden boats Headgear Portrait photography Photography
 Artistic Docks

  context_21: 40 Holloway  Lane
 Singapore 7

  context_22: c.1956

  context_23: 1951

  context_24: 1961

  sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.

metadata.physical_appearance: This print captures a man docking a sampan and securing its oars. He dons a sarong bottom and has his head wrapped in a head scarf. There is yellowing along the perimeter of the print, and the backing on which it is mounted has brown spotting. On the bottom right corner of the print, an RPS Associate 1957 is embossed and on the verso, the photographer studio's chop and title of the work can be found.
